name: Marouane BATTACH
title: Ph.D student
heroSubtitle: Advancing knowledge through research in finance and artificial intelligence
bio: I am a Ph.D student in the Department of Computer Science at . My research focuses on the intersection of artificial intelligence and finance, with particular emphasis on developing robust machine learning models for real-world applications.

I received my Ph.D. in Computer Science from Previous University in 2018, where I worked on deep learning approaches to language understanding. Prior to my current position, I was a postdoctoral researcher at Research Institute, where I developed novel algorithms for computational linguistics.

My work has been published in top-tier conferences and journals including NeurIPS, ICML, ACL, and Nature Machine Intelligence. I am passionate about bridging the gap between theoretical research and practical applications that benefit society.

quickFacts.label: Awards
quickFacts.value: NSF CAREER Award, Best Paper Award
